personal.name: Ismail El Fakir
personal.title: Full Stack Developer
personal.subtitle: Digital Transformation Specialist
personal.description: Specialized in Digital Transformation & Skills Engineering | Experienced in Web Development and Microservices
bio: I'm a passionate Full Stack Developer with experience in creating modern web applications. I specialize in React, Next.js, Node.js, and TypeScript, with a strong focus on creating responsive, accessible, and performant digital solutions.

My journey in web development began during my studies where I discovered my passion for combining creative problem-solving with technical implementation. Since then, I've worked on various projects to deliver exceptional digital experiences.
I'm particularly interested in digital transformation and skills engineering, always looking for ways to innovate and improve educational processes through technology.

projects.title: Web Dev Tests QCM
projects.description: An interactive web application for testing knowledge in various web development domains through multiple-choice quizzes.
projects.longDescription: A dynamic web application designed to help users practice and improve their web development skills through interactive multiple-choice quizzes. It covers topics such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Apache, DNS, and Bootstrap, with real-time progress tracking, instant feedback, and detailed result summaries. Built with React 18, Vite, and Tailwind CSS, and deployed on Vercel for seamless access. The application supports French and offers an intuitive interface for an engaging learning experience.
features: Multiple-choice quizzes across web development topics
Detailed result summaries with answer reviews

projects.title: Quality Evaluation System
projects.description: A web application for evaluating quality in higher education, enabling students, teachers, and staff to assess institutional aspects based on standardized criteria.
projects.longDescription: A sophisticated web application designed for quality evaluation in higher education institutions. It allows students, teachers, and administrative staff to assess various institutional aspects through a hierarchical structure of fields, references, criteria, and questions. The system features role-based question filtering, interactive dashboards with graphical visualizations, automated score calculations, and data export options in Markdown, Excel, and PDF formats. Built with React 18, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, it ensures a responsive, secure, and user-friendly experience, deployed on Vercel.
features: Role-based evaluation for students, teachers, and staff
Hierarchical assessment structure (fields, references, criteria, questions)
Choice and scale question types with automated scoring
Data export in Markdown, Excel, and PDF
Responsive design for desktop, tablet, and mobile

projects.title: LifeInsights Blog
projects.description: A modern, SEO-optimized blog platform offering practical insights on health, education, lifestyle, technology, insurance, and travel, designed for a general audience.
projects.longDescription: LifeInsights Blog is a professional, accessible, and performance-optimized web platform delivering high-quality content on health, education, lifestyle, technology, insurance, and travel. Built with React 18, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, it features over 25 comprehensive articles, organized into six categories, with SEO-friendly URLs, structured data, and Open Graph tags for enhanced discoverability. The mobile-first, WCAG-compliant design includes dark/light mode, intuitive navigation with dropdown menus, search functionality, and a newsletter signup. Deployed on Vercel, it ensures fast loading and a seamless user experience across devices.
features: Over 25 SEO-optimized articles across six categories
Dark/light mode with user preference storage
Professional navigation with dropdown menus and search
React Helmet for dynamic meta tags and structured data
Fast loading with lazy-loaded images and code splitting
